### Solicitation Overview
The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking a contractor to deliver, set up, operate, maintain, disassemble, and remove a fixed-winged mobile aircraft fire trainer as part of annual firefighter re-certification training on bases in Alberta. The trainer must meet the requirements outlined in Standardization Agreement (STANAG) 7145 to support Aircraft Rescue Fire Fighting (ARFF) services.

### Description of the Service
The contractor must provide a mobile aircraft fire trainer with:

* Flight crew and passenger space for conducting firefighting and rescue operations
* Ability to simulate engine fires, fuel spill fires, and wheel brake fires with live fire fueled by propane or liquefied petroleum gas (LPG)
* Extinguishing agent: water

The contractor must also comply with the Mandatory Technical Criteria outlined in the tender package to consider the bid compliant.

### Bid Requirements
The proposed standing offer is for a period of two years (from contract award to March 31, 2026), with up to three (3) one-year option periods.
